We determine the climatic shocks by combining temperature elasticities from DCSW
24 with the change between now and 2050 for spatial population and the number of hot and cold days from the current mean climate under two emission scenarios: RCPs 4.5 and 8.5
25– 27 . We use downscaled and bias-corrected simulations of all 21 Earth System Models (ESMs) that participated in the Coupled Model Intercomparison Project, Phase V (CMIP5) (see the “Methods” section)
33, 34 .
